hearing the title of this album is in
Greek and the word apocalypse actually
descended from this word but in Greek it
translates roughly to Revelation which
can be just as cataclysmic as an

from a biblical standpoint it's not like

something just kind of otherworldly
about it this thing soaks in its own

like becoming the duct tape of studio

like crap throw some reverb on it but
the reverb itself isn't bad it's just
finding out that there's not really
anything behind the reverb on this album
everything that you would want in a good
song is behind the
Reverb some solid playing a simple

Ness there all sorts of cobwebs
everywhere

molds
to the direction that this album is

Chelsea tries on this album I'm not

here were both a little bit of a

and slowly becomes this bigger
shimmering wall of sound that I feel

album kind of shifts into a lot of
different gears from beginning to end
between these ten tracks but it all adds

narrated by Chelsea wolves voice which
is kind of just punctuating the darkness
of this album and just giving it meaning
giving it direction I love the flow of
this album - it doesn't just feel like
the collection of songs I have to kind
of listen to this thing from beginning
